result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
1:39 PM Defendant Conner Harris Brumm appeared by video.  Attorney Sarah M Schmeiser appeared by video for Conner Harris Brumm.  Attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Schmeiser requests another status.  Atty Juech agrees with the status.

BY THE COURT:  Set status
bond continued
Status hearing scheduled for January 17, 2023 at 01:00 pm.
Status hearing on January 17, 2023 at 01:00 pm.

2:01 PM Defendant Conner Harris Brumm appeared by video.  Attorney Sarah M Schmeiser appeared by video for Conner Harris Brumm.  Prosecuting attorney Clifford C. Burdon appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Schmeiser states that the matter is not yet resolved and needs to have a conference with the DA.

BY THE COURT:  Set status
bond continued
Status hearing scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Status hearing on October 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Bond mailed to defendant for signature and return (once cash is posted)
*Defendant will need to post cash by August 30th to the Marquette County Clerk of Courts Office *Appear for booking within 30 days

Atty Schmeiser states that he and the Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading. Atty Schmeiser waives time limits for the Prelim.  Court advises defendant of maximum penalties.  Defendant understands. 
Defense wants to proceed by zoom today.  Court questions the defendant regarding in-person appearance.  Defendant waives their in-person appearance today & will proceed by zoom. 
Defendant agrees with the waiver of time limits.

BY THE COURT:  Defendant waives time limits for the preliminary hearing.

3:20 PM Defendant Conner Harris Brumm appeared by video.  Attorney Sarah M Schmeiser appeared by video for Conner Harris Brumm.  Prosecuting attorney Clifford C. Burdon in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Schmeiser states that her client found out about the warrant yesterday and wants to take care of it.  Court confirms address.

BY THE COURT:  Warrant quashed

Atty Burdon requests a $1,500 cash bond with conditions.
Atty Schmeiser agees.

BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $1,500 Cash bond with conditions: 
*Defendant will need to post cash by August 30th to the Marquette County Clerk of Courts Office
*Appear for booking within 30 days
Status hearing scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Status hearing on September 26, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
